properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: between the townships of Irrewillipe, Kawarren, Lovat, Wimba, Charleys Creek, Carlisle River and covers the township of Gellibrand
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for between the townships of Irrewillipe, Kawarren, Lovat, Wimba, Charleys Creek, Carlisle River and covers the township of Gellibrand. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice Message issued on 11 February 2026. 
  • There is a bushfire at Carlisle River that is under control.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Firefighters remain on site to continue to extinguish any remaining hotspots. 
  • Crews and heavy machinery are working on rehabilitating affected tracks and stabilising key areas of the fire ground.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Carlisle River
Issue Date: Wednesday 11 February 2026, 06:40 pm
Next Update: Friday 13 February 2026, 04:50 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41260/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for between the townships of Irrewillipe, Kawarren, Lovat, Wimba, Charleys Creek, Carlisle River and covers the township of Gellibrand. 
- This Community Information replaces the Advice Message issued on 11 February 2026. 
- There is a bushfire at Carlisle River that is under control.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
- Firefighters remain on site to continue to extinguish any remaining hotspots. 
- Crews and heavy machinery are working on rehabilitating affected tracks and stabilising key areas of the fire ground.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Blackwood, Greendale, Lerderderg. 
  • There is a bushfire at Greendale that is under control.
  • Firefighters with machinery will continue to work on the fire and the surrounding areas.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 10:50 am, Monday 9 February 2026.

Impacts in your area: 
  • All roads in the Lerderberg State Park are closed including: Obriens Road between Greendale-Trentham Road and Bluegum Track.
  • The Lerderderg State Park is closed to all visitors including campers, runners and walkers.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Clarkefield. 
  • The grassfire at Clarkefield is now under control. 
  • On the 11th of January, a fire started near Konagaderra Road and burnt approximately 480 hectares. 
  • Hotspots and smoke may still appear in the burnt area over the next few days.
    Only call Triple Zero (000) if you see an active fire or a clear column of smoke.
  • Local firefighters will continue monitoring the fireground to keep the area safe and respond quickly if anything changes.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice - Stay Informed issued at 9:54am 12.02.2026.
  • Unless the situation changes, this will be the final warning for this fire.
People located within Clarkefield, Wildwood are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Many local roads have been reopened due to the changed conditions, please be aware that some roads may have reduced speed limits.
    Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closure updates.
  • If you have been affected by this fire, please visit VicEmergency - Relief & Recovery for information and support.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - GRASS FIRE - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Clarkefield
Issue Date: Thursday 12 February 2026, 01:49 pm
Next Update: Saturday 14 February 2026, 12:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41272/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Clarkefield. 
- The grassfire at Clarkefield is now under control. 
- On the 11th of January, a fire started near Konagaderra Road and burnt approximately 480 hectares. 
- Hotspots and smoke may still appear in the burnt area over the next few days. 
Only call Triple Zero (000) if you see an active fire or a clear column of smoke. 
- Local firefighters will continue monitoring the fireground to keep the area safe and respond quickly if anything changes. 
- This Advice message replaces the Advice - Stay Informed issued at 9:54am 12.02.2026.
- Unless the situation changes, this will be the final warning for this fire.


People located within Clarkefield, Wildwood are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds.
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds. .
  • This bushfire started 27Km West Of Walwa in Mt Lawson State Park on the 5th January and has spread through to the Wabba Wilderness Park. 
  • The fire is approximately 121,500 hectares and is contained.
  • For the latest Community Recovery Newsletter click HERE
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued on the 8th February, 2026.
  • For more information about Floods, storms and landslides after fires go to  CLICK HERE
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire
Impacts in your area: 
  • The Murray Valley Highway is open.
  • The Benambra-Corryong Road is open.

  • The following parks within the Parks Victoria estate are currently closed to the public: Mount Lawson State Park, Pheasant Creek Flora Reserve, Mountain Creek Education Area, Granya Bushland Reserve, Beetooma Stream Side Reserve, Berringama Bushland Reserve, Wabba Wilderness Park. 
These closures are in place for public safety. To check for updates before planning your visit Click HERE

  • Emergency services, machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.
  • Firefighters are patrolling this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
  • Monitor air quality and take precautions to protect your health by visiting https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/ 
  • For localised mental health support please contact Albury Wodonga Health Mental Health Triage Line on 1300 104 211
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 13/02/2026 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: 27Km West Of Walwa Issue Date: Wednesday 11 February 2026, 11:58 am Next Update: Friday 13 February 2026, 06:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/41223/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for Bucheen Creek, Cravensville, Lucyvale, Cudgewa and the Nariel Valley and surrounds. . - This bushfire started 27Km West Of Walwa in Mt Lawson State Park on the 5th January and has spread through to the Wabba Wilderness Park. - The fire is approximately 121,500 hectares and is contained. - For the latest Community Recovery Newsletter click HERE - This Advice replaces the Advice issued on the 8th February, 2026. - For more information about Floods, storms and landslides after fires go to CLICK HERE There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
